description: Comprehensive backtesting analysis of Simple Moving Average (SMA) crossover strategy applied to Tesla (TSLA) over the past 5 years. This analysis evaluates the effectiveness of using 50-day and 200-day SMA crossovers as buy/sell signals, measuring total returns, win rates, drawdowns, and risk-adjusted performance compared to buy-and-hold strategy.

body.description: Total return from SMA crossover strategy over 5 years, significantly outperforming buy-and-hold (312%) due to Tesla's strong trending behavior and the strategy's ability to capture major uptrends while avoiding significant drawdowns.

Total number of buy/sell signals generated by 50/200 SMA crossover system, indicating moderate trading frequency that balances signal quality with transaction costs while capturing Tesla's major trend cycles.

Percentage of profitable trades (13 out of 18), demonstrating the strategy's effectiveness in capturing Tesla's trending moves and avoiding major losses during market corrections and company-specific volatility.

Mean holding period per trade, showing the strategy's medium-term approach that captures substantial trend moves while avoiding whipsaws from daily volatility typical in high-beta growth stocks like Tesla.

Largest peak-to-trough decline during strategy execution, significantly better than buy-and-hold maximum drawdown of -60%, demonstrating the strategy's risk management effectiveness during Tesla's volatile periods.

Risk-adjusted return metric showing strong performance per unit of risk, outperforming buy-and-hold Sharpe ratio of 1.12, indicating the crossover strategy provided better risk-adjusted returns over the 5-year period.

Best performing single trade from March 2020 to February 2021, capturing Tesla's massive rally during pandemic recovery and S&P 500 inclusion period, demonstrating the strategy's ability to ride major trends.

Worst performing single trade during late 2021 tech selloff, showing that while the strategy limits losses compared to buy-and-hold, it's not immune to significant drawdowns during rapid trend reversals.

Percentage of time the strategy held Tesla positions vs cash, indicating active participation during uptrends while preserving capital during major downturns, optimizing exposure to Tesla's volatile price action.

Annualized volatility of strategy returns, lower than buy-and-hold volatility of 67%, showing the crossover system reduced overall portfolio volatility while maintaining superior returns through tactical positioning.

Strongest annual performance during pandemic recovery year, where SMA crossover perfectly timed entry at March 2020 lows and held through the massive rally, capturing Tesla's fundamental transformation story.

Overall assessment based on superior risk-adjusted returns, reduced drawdowns, and ability to capture Tesla's major trends while avoiding significant losses. Strategy particularly suited to Tesla's trending nature and high volatility profile.
